[Cloud API Overview](overview) &gt; [@adpt/cloud](./cloud.md) &gt; [k8s](./cloud.k8s.md) &gt; [MakeClusterInfoOptions](./cloud.k8s.makeclusterinfooptions.md) &gt; [kubeconfig](./cloud.k8s.makeclusterinfooptions.kubeconfig.md)

## k8s.MakeClusterInfoOptions.kubeconfig property

A Javascript Object representing a valid kubeconfig, or a YAML string, or a path to a kubeconfig file.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
kubeconfig?: Kubeconfig | string;
```

## Remarks

If this is a Javascript object, it will be treated like a parsed kubeconfig. If this is a string, [k8s.makeClusterInfo()](./cloud.k8s.makeclusterinfo.md) will first attempt to parse it as JSON. If that fails, it will attempt to parse it as YAML. If that fails it will treat the string as a path of configs (like with the `KUBECONFIG` environment variable).

If kubeconfig is missing [k8s.makeClusterInfo()](./cloud.k8s.makeclusterinfo.md) will use the `KUBECONFIG` environment variable to build a suitable config using `kubectl config view --flatten` and return that as the kubeconfig in the resulting [k8s.ClusterInfo](./cloud.k8s.clusterinfo.md)
